cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 1170 miles ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic and expected to bend northwest toward the South-North Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina/South Carolina border (Wilmington–Myrtle Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time (watches expected to be issued Tuesday for the SC–NC coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from northern Florida through North Carolina and into the mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) have a 53% cumulative chance; 50-kt winds have a 22% chance, with earliest onset around 72 h and peak around 120 h.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Major hurricane approaching from the east is likely to push water toward the South Carolina coast producing surge higher than 3 ft, especially with the strong onshore flow ahead of landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands and eventual passage could dump well over 4 inches of rain, with totals potentially exceeding 10 inches along the South Carolina coast and inland.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large, dangerous surf and rip currents already affecting the coast; possible coastal flooding and port channel shoaling.
